original: Conradi, Knut Erland Georg, major, direktör, Linköping, f. 18/12/82 i Sthlm av kapt. Georg C. o. Hilda Ruth. G. 11 m. Greta Cohrs. Barn: Erland f. 12, Cecilia 13, Georg 16, Agneta 20, Urban 28. — Mog:ex. 02, off:ex. 04, KHS 12-14. Res. t. Tyskl. 99 o. 16, Frankr. 39. Und:löjtn. 04, löjtn. v. Kalmar reg. 06, lär. v. KS 17-18, kapt. 19, armékomm. 24-25, förste adjut. v. n. arméfördeln istaben 25-27, på friv. övorg:stat 27, major i armén 32. Verkst. dir. f. System A-B i Skara 27-37, dito i Skövde 37-38 o. i Linköp. sed. 38. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd FeWow, SHT o. Par Bricole. RSO, RVO.
translated: Conradi, Knut Erland Georg, Major, Director, Linköping, born December 18, 1882 in Stockholm, son of Captain Georg C. and Hilda Ruth. Married for 11 years to Greta Cohrs. Children: Erland born in 1912, Cecilia in 1913, Georg in 1916, Agneta in 1920, and Urban in 1928. Completed Military Upper Secondary School in 1912-1914 after graduating from a municipal school. Travelled to Germany in 1899 and 1916, and to France in 1939. Was a Second Lieutenant in 1904, Lieutenant in the Kalmar Regiment in 1906, teacher at Military Upper Secondary School in 1917-1918, Captain in 1919, Army Commander in 1924-1925, First Adjutant to the Northern Army Distribution Staff in 1925-1927, and in the Voluntary Military Training Organisation in 1927 before becoming Major in the Army in 1932. Executive Director at System AB in Skara from 1927-1937, in Skövde from 1937-1938, and in Linköping from 1938 until his last known position. Member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellows, the Society of the History of Technology, and the Par Bricole. Awarded the Order of the Sword and the Royal Order of Vasa.

structured.name: Knut Erland Georg Conradi

memberOf.name: Society of the History of Technology

structured.description: Knut Erland Georg Conradi was a Swedish military officer and company executive. He was a Major in the Swedish Army and served as Director of various companies, including System AB.
